Comment: Also pto, means 'circular orifice'. *Piro-Apuriná form is *põ-pɨ-rV-rV.
'Side (of person)' is kwansata. Also sreta, side of region; and sc̷i.
Also means 'lip' 04.250. Also tamnɨ taxi; c̷exita.
'Twig' is kano, also means 'arm' 04.310. Also hah-mɨna-'pľɨ. *Piro-Apuriná form is *hãhã-'po-rɨ.
'Twig' is kano, also means 'arm' 04.310. Also hah-mɨna-'pľɨ. *Piro-Apuriná form is *hãhã-'po-rɨ.
'Twig' is kano, also means 'arm' 04.310. Also hah-mɨna-'pľɨ. *Piro-Apuriná form is *hãhã-'po-rɨ.
A flat seed is tata, also means 'fishscale'. *Piro-Apuriná form is *'kɨ.
A flat seed is tata, also means 'fishscale'. *Piro-Apuriná form is *'kɨ.
Also to-ha, lit. 'her-liquid'; cf. 'water' 01.310. *Piro-Apuriná form is *(t)o-ha.
Also to-ha, lit. 'her-liquid'; cf. 'water' 01.310. *Piro-Apuriná form is *(t)o-ha.
Also kpitʸowaka. 'Oily' is xhi. *Piro-Apuriná form is *n-hĩ-c̷i.
Verbal form is hišpika; šišpoka; taľha.
Refers to a bamboo knife. *Piro-Apurina form is *yo-'wa-ta.
To chew in order to soften is hamľoka.
Means to suckle. Also hačiča. *Piro-Apuriná form is *ha'si-ta.
From the Campa language. A deaf person is maxnakotɨ.
A tiny boil is košičisrɨ. To have a boil is yoma-wata.
Verbal forms are hahita; hamľaka; hamľaxita; kaxitewata.
Also pčoľe. To have a sore is hic̷reta. A blotch on skin is pirne.
Also pčoľe. To have a sore is hic̷reta. A blotch on skin is pirne.
To be sick is hahixewna; yayitʸa. *Piro-Apuriná form is *põhã.
To be sick is hahixewna; yayitʸa. *Piro-Apuriná form is *põhã.
To be waked up is hiyoka.
See introduction for explanation of this long string of short morphemes.
Also hapšeka, to bite into; hastaka, to bite off.
Also hapšeka, to bite into; hastaka, to bite off.
To try to v. is yotokota.
Verbal form is hic̷kahata; also hapľika, to spit out.
To perspire at night is pohnanɨwata.
'Abdomen' is nanwaka; satɨ; 'large abdomen' is čkete; 'lower abdomen' is skota; 'upper abdomen' is hema. *Piro-Apuriná forms are *ti'ka-te/ko; *hi-tika-mapa/ko.
Latter is woman's breast. In baby talk it is čočo. *Piro-Apuriná form is *'tɨ-nɨ.
Latter is woman's breast. In baby talk it is čočo. *Piro-Apuriná form is *'tɨ-nɨ.
'Small feather' is pitʸi. 'Plumage' is paxi. *Piro-Apuriná form is *'piti.
'Sole of foot' is stap-xitʸi. *Piro-Apuriná form is *'kiti.
Also means 'fist'. 'Underside of knee' is c̷keri. 'Kneebone' is skiwhapɨ.
Respectively: lower and upper leg. 'Femur (thighbone)' is tpaľ-hapɨ.
Respectively: lower and upper leg. 'Femur (thighbone)' is tpaľ-hapɨ.
'Little finger' is mtɨrɨxi; 'index finger' is yokhipi.
Especially back of neck. Neck of water jar is noxi-ta. *Piro-Apuriná form is *-'no-pi/ki.
'Tip of the tongue' is ptonˑɨ. *Piro-Apuriná form is *'nɨnɨ.
The latter refers to a curved beak.
The latter refers to a curved beak.
Lit. 'nose-hole'. Orifice of a snout is smata.
Also refers to 'prow'. 'Snout' is smitʸi; šrište. 'Bridge of nose' is skoma-xri. *Piro-Apuriná form is *ki'ri-ta.
The latter is used in compounds. 'Eyeball' is yhaľsahi. 'Pupil of eye' is ksaxire-yhaľe.
The latter is used in compounds. 'Eyeball' is yhaľsahi. 'Pupil of eye' is ksaxire-yhaľe.
'To face' is kastata. The face below forehead is hoxiswaha.
To be bloody is xra. *Piro-Apuriná form is *hira-'ka/ha.
Trunk of human body is paxi; stono.
Also popnixiro; wroľo. 'Bumble bee' is hanohyo; yatmeroxi.
Also kačiči, with *Piro-Apuriná form *ka'c̷i-ti. *Piro-Apuriná form is *-pokhi.
Refers to 'cebus m.' 'Spider m. is mčira. Howler m. is kina. Also kac̷na-ľɨ; kamyoľɨ. *Piro-Apuriná forms are *c̷i'ko-tɨ; *k-ac̷ana-rɨ.
Also flat shell is tata. *Piro-Apuriná form is *tata.
Also serotľapaľɨ, a red-headed v.; kľatataľɨ, a white v. *Piro-Apuriná form is *ma'yo-rɨ.
The latter means 'to domesticate'. *Piro-Apuriná form is *pɨ'ra.
The latter means 'to domesticate'. *Piro-Apuriná form is *pɨ'ra.
Respectively: 'he; she'. 'Her' is to-, o-. *Piro-Apuriná form for 'her' is *to.
Respectively: 'he; she'. 'Her' is to-, o-. *Piro-Apuriná form for 'her' is *to.
'My' is no-; n-. *Piro-Apuriná form for 'I' is *hi/'no-ta; for 'my' is *n(V)-.
'My' is no-; n-. *Piro-Apuriná form for 'I' is *hi/'no-ta; for 'my' is *n(V)-.
Vocative form is xiro. *Piro-Apuriná form is *ha-'ki-ro.
Vocative form is to-tɨ. *Piro-Apuriná forms are *ha-toki-rɨ; *'to-tɨ.
'To have as older s.' Also yehwakľɨ, older s., with vocative yeye. 'Younger s.' is hepɨrɨ.
Vocative form is mama. *Piro-Apuriná form is *'na-to/ro.
Vocative form is mama. *Piro-Apuriná form is *'na-to/ro.
Vocative form is pa-pa. *Piro-Apurina forms are *'hɨ-rɨ; *pa-tɨ/pa.
Vocative form is pa-pa. *Piro-Apurina forms are *'hɨ-rɨ; *pa-tɨ/pa.
To take a husband is hanɨrɨta; to take a wife is hanɨnrota.
Means to make fire; to fix the fire is yotʸpaka.
A cold wind is hanˑatɨ. A breeze is kawľerɨ.
A cold wind is hanˑatɨ. A breeze is kawľerɨ.
Also yečno; and map-ša-ha-ľɨ, 'dark'. *Piro-Apuriná form is *mapi-sia-'hã-rɨ.
Also yečno; and map-ša-ha-ľɨ, 'dark'. *Piro-Apuriná form is *mapi-sia-'hã-rɨ.
Verbal form is hatata. Also hatnɨ; and yowɨ, flash of light.
'Evening star' is kayikawsahi; 'morning star' is honsahi; 'Pleiades' is kačkehiri.
Also means 'month' 14.710. To be full moon is tɨpľakwahata. *Piro-Apuriná form is *ka'sɨ-rɨ.
A large wave is hokano. To make waves is šašpɨrha.
To make water foamy is hašľirika. *Piro-Apuriná form is *'sori.
'Churning water' is pomča. 'Fluid' is xha; xpa.
'Churning water' is pomča. 'Fluid' is xha; xpa.
Refers to farther bank; nearer bank is wanha ~ wnaha. 'Beach' is soľxi. 'Edge of shore' is spɨwnaha.
Also c̷rɨpxita. Foot of h. is mahka c̷kata; slope of h. is mahka xripi; summit of h. is mahka c̷opo; hillside is mahka tamnɨ; crest of hill is mrixi.
Also c̷rɨpxita. Foot of h. is mahka c̷kata; slope of h. is mahka xripi; summit of h. is mahka c̷opo; hillside is mahka tamnɨ; crest of hill is mrixi.
Also čixi pahi. Cf. 'ashes' 01.840; hwɨ-pahi is 'pollen', lit. 'flower-dust/particles'. *Piro-Apuriná form is *'pa-hi-nɨ.
Latter refers to sour liquid. 'To sour' is pɨsata.
Latter refers to sour liquid. 'To sour' is pɨsata.
To be jealous of a spouse is khoko.
To be jealous of a spouse is khoko.
Also kaxi-tɨ, refers to nonIndian populace. *Piro-Apuriná form is *kã'kɨ-tɨ.
